quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: In two minutes I want you to come into this meeting and tell me I have a really important phone call. I’m not going to take it because I want him to know how important the meeting is to me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Who’s calling?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Nobody. Just say that I'm-  Just make it up that I have a phone call. And then I’m going to refuse to take it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You’re not going to take it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Just make up a phone call. It’s not a real call. Make it up.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Ohohohoh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And come and tell me. Doesn’t matter what it is.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You’re not going to get it though?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m not going to take it. And then he’s going to be like “whoa this is a really important meeting”.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Copy that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ok, so tell me exactly what kind of deal you are getting now and I’ll tell you how we can beat it.

quotes.speaker: Client
quotes.line: Uh well we’ve been going with…

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: You have a very important call.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m sorry – I’m with a very important client. It’ll have to wait.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Are you sure? It’s really, really important.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: There is nothing more important to me right now than this meeting.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Really? Because your mother is dead.

quotes.speaker: Client
quotes.line: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don’t think she’s dead.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: She’s dead. She was hit by a bus.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: She’s not dead. This is exactly the kind of thing my mom pulls.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: This isn’t one of those times. It’s the police. They said it’s the worst they’ve ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Andy I’m really sorry about your mother. My deepest condolences.

quotes.speaker: Client
quotes.line: Oh you must take this call. It's…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. Um line 1?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Line 2.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: [on phone]It’s Darryl. Erin told me to pretend to be a cop and say your mom died.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ooh, gosh!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Dude.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Officer.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Look man this is a bad idea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Did she have any last words or?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Really? That is messed up man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh make sure that your client gets the best deal possible.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You’re a bad man Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That is so mom.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That stuff can come back to get you. It’s called karma. You do not want to be messing around. I got an uncle…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright thank you officer. Erin please hold all my other calls. Where were we?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey Cathy.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How’s it going? Everything make sense?

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: I think everything is under control.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: You should sit down.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh no, I’m fine.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: No I should go fill out my paperwork.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok [squeaking sound] Oh that was just me. Pregnant Pam. And I make sounds much worse than this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh we know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m training a temp to be my replacement while I’m on maternity leave. Oh I should’ve mentioned I’m pregnant. You probably didn’t notice because it’s impossible to tell I’m so small. But yeah I’m pregnant. [another squeak] Oh come on!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey – asking for a friend. Do you happen to know if that new girl is single?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hmm. Doubt it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah me too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You doubt it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why do you doubt that she’s single?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Honestly I have no idea. I just figured we’d save her from Ryan right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What are you doing with my lunch?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m delivering it from the fridge. It’s like a porno. Hey did anyone order a pizza?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It’s not pizza.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah and we’re not about to make love. I just thought maybe you’d want to eat lunch at your desk today so that during lunch we could go down to the warehouse and bang out a few tunes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I like the sound of that. Is Kevin in?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh you tell me [Kevin playing drums with chicken legs]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: So word on the street is she has a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Well he’s probably a drug dealer. That’s the best way to land a hot girlfriend. You just uh get her hooked on blow.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It’s going to be nice to have just a healthy, young, fit presence in the middle of the office.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah aesthetically speaking she adds a nice presence.

quotes.speaker: Offscreen
quotes.line: Good energy

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It’s going to be good to have someone hot at Pam’s desk huh?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No, no. Not even.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m kidding! Oh my gosh you guys! She’s obviously super cute I get it. But I’d like to point out there’s 50 pounds more of me to love if that’s your thing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Pam you look more beautiful now than ever.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Radiant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you. Really you guys thank you. Very sweet.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah you have this sexy glow.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: It’s one of the most common fetishes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really well thank you all.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know it’s not just pregnant women who don’t get their due. You know who’s gorgeous? Helen Mirren.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yes! Have you seen her in a bikini? Amazing?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know what would be the hottest thing ever? It’s a pregnant Helen Mirren.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok ok ok no no no. This is disgusting. You realize what you’re saying? The hottest thing ever would be a 66 year old pregnant woman.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: In this case yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! There are universal biological standards of beauty and attraction. And you are purposefully celebrating the opposite of them to mollycoddle a pregnant woman.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No we’re not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes you are. And another thing. Helen Mirren was born Helen Mironov. That’s right. You’re fake salivating over a Soviet era Russian.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [scatting] Ske-be-do-bah-bap-bah-de, ske-be-de-bapa-de-bapa-boopa-dooten-bebe-daten-booray.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Nice scatting, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you. I think I said doop instead of boop at one point.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: Not bad fellas, you're better than you look.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey, screw you!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [sees Robert California enter] Hey Robert, are we meeting early?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Just taking a stroll. What exactly have I stumbled upon here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well we're all musicians and we play together sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You're a band.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: We're called Kevin and the Zits.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That was never agreed upon.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I miss being in a band.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Miss no more! What do you play? Join us!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I have a tambourine.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Tambourine? You know I’m the CEO, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [to Kevin] CEOs don't play tambourines. Tambourines are for girlfriends.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I play harmonica. I think I have one in the car.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Great!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nice guys, Robert is going to be a Zit!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Again, never agreed upon.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I had totally given up on hanging out with Robert California and now he wants to be in our band! And when you're in a rock and roll band with somebody, you're bonded for life!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Usually that life is short and tragic. That's okay, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, even cooler.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: We all got to go sometime.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Helen Mirren. Hot?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. Super pretty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Huh. What about Cathy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The temp?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. Do you think she's hot?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm not asking if you're in to her. Just, objectively, do you find her attractive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And I'm telling you, I don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You don't find Cathy attractive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I'm not going to tell my nine-months-pregnant wife that I find her replacement objectively attractive. Just like I’m not going to tell my two-year-old daughter that violent video games are objectively more fun. It's true, but it doesn't help anybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Look at her. Even I want some fries with that shake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. Uh, I don't. So are we good? [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's just absurd.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, because she's hot, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Her breasts are large, her waist is small, her reproductive health in ample evidence. And facial symmetry- come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: The thing about pregnancy is people treat you differently. Like you're a kid almost. They lose all sense of boundaries. They start acting weird, telling you things that clearly aren't true. I know it sounds nuts, but I think Dwight is the only one who's telling me the truth.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight, am I hot right now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why would I or anyone else think that you're hot right now? I can't impregnate you, and that's the driving force between male-female attraction.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What about before? Was I attractive before?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Meh... you were at your most attractive when you were 24 with a slight, gradual decline and a steep drop-off when you got pregnant for the first time. Gradual recovery and, uh, well now, obviously, you're at an all-time low.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm. I think Jim’s lying to me about not being attracted to Cathy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You think Jim’s lying? [laughs] That's so cute. I know he's lying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Five bucks if you can get him to admit it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Done. [Pam goes for a high five] I never touch a pregnant woman.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yep, that's the Dwight I need.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If we're going to work together, we need some ground rules.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Rule one: our only loyalty is to the truth.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think so. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Rule two: we stop at nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, what does that... is that... okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Rule three: Don't fall in love.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yep, good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We're gonna bust this guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Honesty is very important to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So important. And then we will destroy the man himself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Let's just see how we feel when we get there.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, you came to the right person. You have to follow your intuition, Pam. You don't want to end up like Elin Nordegren. Actually, what am I saying, you wish you had her life- no offense, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: None taken. What do you got?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: It is called the matchmaker test, and it is very powerful. Basically we have Pam ask Jim which of his friends he would set up with Cathy. If Jim picks a really hot friend, then we know that he thinks that Cathy's hot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [to the keyboardist, Curtis, and the drummer] Hey, you found us!

quotes.speaker: Curtis
quotes.line: You guys sound great, man.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Darryl, Andy, Kevin, this is Curtis Dorough, local musician and the officiate at my wedding.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Local musician? Local legend! I used to come hear you play every week at the Deerhead.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [to drummer] Dude, you're on TV! You’re the sportscaster on channel seven.

quotes.speaker: Drummer
quotes.line: Go Eagles! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You do that on TV!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You guys mind if they join us?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, absolutely!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Guys, I've got some instruments right here. [holds up tambourine and güiro]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, why don't you and me play those?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah? Okay, this is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: What should we play?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Maybe we should warm up with some scales?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Midnight Rambler?

quotes.speaker: Curtis
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Midnight what?

quotes.speaker: Curtis
quotes.line: [singing] Have you heard about the midnight rambler? [Lisa, the guitarist, enters] Hey, come on in, baby. Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, I was talking to Cathy. Turns out she is single.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I stand corrected.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I thought it might be fun to set her up with someone. Any ideas?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, you know who might be good? Mike Tibbets.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Mike Tibbets, really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey, who's this Mike Tibbets guy? What kind of car does he drive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not his mom's car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, 'cause his mom's car's probably not a Nissan Z.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Touche?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [sees photo of Mike Tibbets] Eww!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kelly, calm down.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I mean, I guess he'd be okay with hair. Okay, you should see if he'll get hair plugs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't think Jim cares about his hair.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, but I do Pam, okay? It's called being a nice person.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't see what's so ugly about him. He's got the broad face of a brewer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim's on to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, Jim barely talks to Mike. We had to go through like two levels of friends to even find his profile. Jim picked someone just unattractive enough to shut me up without tipping it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just ugly enough to have deniability.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mike Tibbets is like the most boring-looking guy I know. So if that was for the matchmaker test, I think I'm in the clear. If that wasn't for the matchmaker test, then... Cathy, he's a really nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, Jim may be lying with his words, but he can't lie with his body.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I'm gonna write something mean on his wall.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, Kelly, don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The male reveals attraction through unconscious and involuntary physical signs. The puffing of the chest, mirroring, increased blood flow to the crotch. I say we start there.

quotes.speaker: Pam and Kelly
quotes.line: With the crotch?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: With the crotch.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [music plays] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Psst. We're not here. [slips Toblerone candy to Creed]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Who said that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: How'd I get this long triangle?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, just shut it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is he puffing out his chest?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can't tell. It's unnaturally sunken. [Jim says something and Cathy laughs] Busted. He just was mirroring. Did you see that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No. Maybe he just said something funny.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim has no discernible sense of humor, Pam. You should know that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think he's just making her laugh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Time for me to find out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why's he making her laugh so much?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just going to walk over here- [fake trips] whoa, whoa, I'm slipping and falling! Oh, stumbling, I need something to grab on to! [grabs Jim's crotch]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm fine, I'm totally fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes? [Jim pushes Dwight's hands away] Wha- Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Cathy] Sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Aw, cramp, I'm just- [grabs Jim's crotch again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight! [pushes Dwight's hands away] Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm sorry, I fell down, Mr. Balance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Leave.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to Pam] Does your husband have very soft erections? Because if not, I just grabbed a very soft penis for nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why was he making her laugh so much?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, hey, I'll just be a second.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: Yeah, take your time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: [to Jim] Oh, that line from Zoolander?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm?

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: It was from a deleted scene so we were both right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [laughs] Told you.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: Um, do I hand in my expense reports to a particular accountant or-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oscar, Cathy has a question!

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.line: Sorry, um, I'll just go ask Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [to Jim] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why won't you just admit that she's attractive? It's kind of annoying that you won't say it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, what can I do to make you believe me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, Dwight had this idea, and I thought it was kind of crazy. But maybe that's where we are now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: She called it crazy? Aw, man, that's insulting. All I did was propose a makeshift lie-detector test. Monitoring his blood pressure, pulse, perspiration, and breathing rate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, its nuts. But I don't know what else to do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And she called it nuts?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Seriously, that was hot. Feel like you and the newsman had a groove going.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Did you know that Lisa toured with Chaka Khan?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Are you serious? From Star Trek?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: [to Val] Hey, you caught some of that?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: I caught it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What, you don't like the blues?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: I might enjoy seeing you guys play the blues.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, we are playing. We're all playing together. These are our jam buddies. It's a jam session. We go where the music takes us. [music starts]

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: I think the music left without you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Stop shoving me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [mocking] Stop shoving me. Stop grabbing my penis. Grow up. Take off your jacket and take a seat. When it lies, the human body exhibits many telltale signs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Pam] Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This could all go away if you just tell me the truth.

quotes.speaker: Old Man
quotes.line: Uh, are you all in line?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why don't you go check out the sympathy cards, old man? [to Jim] Now I'm going to ask you just a few simple questions. Wait for this to constrict. Here we go. Is your name Jim Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Si.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wait, that's it? That's the question you're going to ask him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We have to start with a baseline question to establish what the truth is.

quotes.speaker: Old Man
quotes.line: You have to share the machine with others.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [mimicking] Well, that's what they taught me in my 19th century kindergarten.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, Dwight, come on. [to old man] You can go first.

quotes.speaker: Old Man
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, you know what? This reminds me, Cece needs a new toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Maybe we could switch instruments.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: 'Cause, uh, my body's starting to get bruised.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, maybe everyone move one instrument to the right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We had to leave because of creative differences.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah they kind of had a specific sound that didn't really fit in with our thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Guys, this means they're Kevin and the Zits now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No man, we are.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to old man] Okay, you're done.

quotes.speaker: Old Man
quotes.line: I have a new heart, you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you really, Tin Man? Okay, where were we?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I'm not worried. Because this lie isn't for me, it's for Pam. And when she gets her body back and her confidence back... yes, I will tell her the truth. That I had feelings for a co-worker today that I haven't had in years. But in my defense, he was grabbing my crotch fairly aggressively at the time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you find Cathy Simms attractive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yep, he's lying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ah, see, was that so hard?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am not lying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam, are you really gonna listen to his stupid homemade test?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I would listen to my homemade test, because your husband is definitely lying. In fact, he's lied about every question. Even his name. Who are you really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Look at the numbers. Every single time, it's come up 150 over 100. Your husband is a pathological liar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim, you have high blood pressure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, he is definitely attracted to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Doesn't your dad have high blood pressure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, but I don't smoke.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: When was the last time you went to the doctor?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's important to go every month and get your prostate checked. You can do it at home by yourself with your finger. You just stick it-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight, stop. I'm not kidding, I mean, I need you to take care of yourself. What would we do if something happened to you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, easy. Trust me, I'm around for the long-haul.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's not really your choice, is it? Death waits for no man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Come on, let's go. I wanna call your doctor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Doesn't it worry you in the slightest that Jim is not his real name?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just go home. It doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: But... hey, Cece's toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Darryl
quotes.line: Oh baby I love your way.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Every day.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Darryl
quotes.line: Wanna be with you night and day.

quotes.speaker: Darryl and Kevin
quotes.line: And day.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Darryl
quotes.line: Oh baby I love your way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [scatting] Rudit-do-do-do-di-do.
